title: What is the best non-copyrighted music which is free to use? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you want recordings, you will have a hard time finding things. Performers hold copyright on their performances for 70 years, if I recall, and can renew it for longer. So you would have to look for less well known music from 1940 and before. If you want to perform it yourself, you are in better luck. Composers have copyright for the same length of time, but we have much older scores than records. The classical canon — Bach, Beethoven, Mozart and their contemporaries— should be available for performance without copyright (but someone correct me if I’m wrong!). There might be some newer compositions, ie Brahms or Stravinsky, that are out of copyright, but check before using them.

Hey, Check out Home for the best non copyrighted music. ( Although the link show Home, but just tap on it, it works fine ). Don't forget to give credits to the original creator. Cheers, The Xenial Secret
